marklogic.body: The Port William at Trebarwith Strand is a great place to watch a stormy sea. Storm waves often explode into Penhallic point and I've seen them break over Gull Rock (about 90ft tall) before. As well as being dramatic, there are a couple of things that make this a good Spot for watching a stormy sea: - it's safe: you aren't likely to get blown the coast path into the sea as it's a walled paved area Reached by road (Dodman Point at Lundy Bay is lovely but a bit iffy with a strong wind and when the grass is slippery) - you can nip into the pub for a warm up in front of the fire with a pint of Tribute (it's West facing so you can see rainstorms approaching over the sea and dive into the pub just in time)
